1.text: Whoso loveth knowledge loveth correction; But he that is brutish hateth reproof.

2.text: A good man shall obtain favour of the LORD; But a man of wicked devices will He condemn.

3.text: A man shall not be established by wickedness; But the root of the righteous shall never be moved.

4.text: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband; But she that doeth shamefully is as rottenness in his bones.

5.text: The thoughts of the righteous are right; But the counsels of the wicked are deceit.

6.text: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood; But the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

7.text: The wicked are overthrown, and are not; But the house of the righteous shall stand.

8.text: A man shall be commended according to his intelligence; But he that is of a distorted understanding shall be despised.

9.text: Better is he that is lightly esteemed, and hath a servant, Than he that playeth the man of rank, and lacketh bread.

10.text: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast; But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

11.text: He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread; But he that followeth after vain things is void of understanding.

12.text: The wicked desireth the prey of evil men; But the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.

13.text: In the transgression of the lips is a snare to the evil man; But the righteous cometh out of trouble.

14.text: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, And the doings of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.

15.text: The way of a fool is straight in his own eyes; But he that is wise hearkeneth unto counsel.

16.text: A fool’s vexation is presently known; But a prudent man concealeth shame.

17.text: He that breatheth forth truth uttereth righteousness; But a false witness deceit.

18.text: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword; But the tongue of the wise is health.

19.text: The lip of truth shall be established for ever; But a lying tongue is but for a moment.

20.text: Deceit is in the heart of them that devise evil; But to the counsellors of peace is joy.

21.text: There shall no mischief befall the righteous; But the wicked are filled with evil.

22.text: Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD; But they that deal truly are His delight.

23.text: A prudent man concealeth knowledge; But the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.

24.text: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule; But the slothful shall be under tribute.

25.text: Care in the heart of a man boweth it down; But a good word maketh it glad.

26.text: The righteous is guided by his friend; But the way of the wicked leadeth them astray.

27.text: The slothful man shall not hunt his prey; But the precious substance of men is to be diligent.

28.text: In the way of righteousness is life, And in the pathway thereof there is no death.
